vocabulary.example: Good riddance! [exp] - Glad to be far away from something!
a pile [n] - a small collection, in the shape of a small hill
a drumstick [n] - the leg of a chicken (after it has been cooked)
restore [v] - bring back to the original state
Stay out of it! [exp] - Don't get involved!
an armpit [n] - the area under the arm near the shoulder

vocabulary.word: I did not see that coming
vocabulary.example: I did not see that coming [exp] - I did not expect that to happen
a hook [n] - A curved tool for catching fish
Get it away from me! [exp] - Don't let it be close to me!
smite [v] - strike or hit hard (smite | smote | smote, smitten)
a homing beacon [n] - a signal that attracts something from far away
the second that [exp] - as soon as

questions.question: Who wants Maui to take the Heart back to the island of Te Fiti?
Why does Maui refuse to go to Te Fiti at first?
options: He wants to find his magical fish hook first.
He does not believe that Te Fiti exists.
He thinks Moana is too young.
He is afraid of the journey.

questions.question: Why does Maui take the chicken?
options: It knows where his fish hook is.

questions.question: Why does Maui panic when Moana holds up the Heart?
options: He is worried that Moana will drop it into the ocean.
He is worried that Te Fiti will see them.
He thinks it is too powerful for her.
He believes it will bring danger.

questions.question: What happened when Maui first found the Heart?
options: He sank to the bottom of the sea.
His body got covered in tattoos.
He got knocked out of the sky.
He lost his magic fish hook.

questions.question: What does Maui think will happen if they take the Heart to Te Fiti?
options: They will get blasted out of the sky.
They will be able to create life.

questions.question: What are the Kakamora?
options: People from the island of Te Fiti

questions.question: What is Moana's first reaction to the Kakamora?
options: She tries to make peace with them.

grammar.explanation: Choose the word and place in the sentence that most logically connects the ideas in the sentence. Use words like: to, not, is, did, are, out, from, it, that, so, what, of. Some boxes will be empty.

exercises.sentence: You have yours, and I'm ___ Maui without mine.
It's a beautiful cave. She ___ going to love it.
What is your problem? ___ you afraid of it?
The second I took it, I got blasted ___ of the sky.
If you don't put ___ away, bad things ___ going to come for it.
You are going to ___ us killed!
I'm going to get us to Te Fiti ___ you can put it back.
Murdering little pirates. I wonder ___ they're here for.

transcript.full:
Maui: No. I'm not going to Te Fiti with some kid. I'm going to get my hook. You have yours, and I'm not Maui without mine. Okay, talk to the back.

Maui: Boat snack.

Maui: Good riddance, you filthy pile of pebbles.

Maui: Oh, no, no, no. Don't look at me like that. It's a beautiful cave. She's going to love it. And I'm going to love you in my belly. Now, let's fatten you up, drumstick.

Maui: I could watch that all day. Okay. Enjoy the island. Maui, out.

Moana: No! Stop! Hey! You have to put back the Heart!

Maui: (I) Did not see that coming.

Moana: I am Moana of Motun...

Maui: It was Moana, right?

Moana: Yes. And you will restore the Heart!

Maui: All right. I'm out. Oh, come on!

Moana: What is your problem? Are you afraid of it?

Maui: No! No. I'm not afraid. Stay out of it, or you're sleeping in my armpit. You, stop it. That is not a heart. It is a curse. The second I took it, I got blasted out of the sky and I lost my hook. Get it away from me.

Moana: Get this away?

Maui: Hey, hey, hey! I'm a demigod, okay? Stop that. I will smite you! You want to get smote? Smotten? Listen, that thing doesn't give you power to create life. It's a homing beacon of death. If you don't put it away, bad things are going to come for it.

Moana: Come for this? The Heart? You mean this heart right here? Come and get it!

Maui: You are going to get us killed!

Moana: No, I'm going to get us to Te Fiti so you can put it back. Thank you. You're welcome.

Maui: Kakamora.

Moana: Kaka-what?

Maui: Murdering little pirates. I wonder what they're here for.

Moana: They're kind of cute.
